description.narrative: By 2024, Gaps in laws, policies, strategies and guidelines are identified, closed and progressively implemented and monitored in line with international norms and standards., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, Significantly more children under five, adolescents and women of childbearing age access and utilize proven direct nutrition interventions and practice appropriate nutrition behaviors that prevent stunting and other manifestations of malnutrition in both development and humanitarian conditions.

sector.narrative: Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, Gaps in laws, policies, strategies and guidelines are identified, closed and progressively implemented and monitored in line with international norms and standards.

description.narrative: By August 2020, Stunting reduction has been included as a priority in the Government's development agenda the “Pro Poor Agenda for Prosperity and Development (PAPD) 2018 – 2023”; the national nutrition Policy (NNP) and integrated management of acute malnutrition (IMAM) guideline have been updated in line with international norms and standards and are presently being implemented; 14 standards nutrition indicators integrated in the health management information system and nutrition content integrated into the new Nursing and Midwifery Curriculum. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: Implementation of a national strategy to prevent stunting in children
Existence of a national nutrition strategy that includes micronutrient powders for children.
Existence of a national management information system that includes disaggregated data on nutrition, including sex-disaggregated data
Country has a budgeted plan to eliminate water and fluids to support increase in exclusive breastfeeding
Country has a budgeted plan to improve dietary diversity
